tool.name: HAPplot
tool.description: Generates a haplotype blob plot for one or two assemblies using hap-mer tables from HAPmaker
tool.command: #set ASSEMBLY1="assembly."+$assembly_1.ext ln -s $maternal maternal.hap.ktab && ln -s $paternal paternal.hap.ktab && ln -s $assembly_1 $ASSEMBLY1 && #if $assembly_2: #set ASSEMBLY2="assembly2."+$assembly_2.ext ln -s $assembly_2 $ASSEMBLY2 && #end if ln -s $hapmaker_ktab_file ktab_files.tar.gz && tar -xf ktab_files.tar.gz -C '.' && HAPplot @PLOTS@ $pdf -T\${GALAXY_SLOTS:-1} maternal.hap.ktab paternal.hap.ktab $ASSEMBLY1 #if $assembly_2: $ASSEMBLY2 #end if happlot

param.name: maternal
param.label: Maternal Hap-mer Ktab file generated from HAPmaker

param.name: paternal
param.label: Paternal Hap-mer Ktab file generated from HAPmaker

param.name: hapmaker_ktab_file
param.label: Select the TAR file consisting of intermediate files given out from HAPmaker

param.name: assembly_1
param.label: Assembly of genome
param.help: Must be same genome as the HAP-mer table was generated from

param.name: assembly_2
param.label: Additional assembly file
param.help: Additional genome against which to compare

tool.help:
This tool creates a haplotype blob plot for an assembly (or two assemblies if provided).
It uses hap-mer tables (<mat>.hap.ktab for maternal and <pat>.hap.ktab for paternal) made with HAPmaker.
Each contig (assembly segment) is shown as a blob. The blob's size represents the contig's length, and its position on the plot is based on the counts of maternal hap-mers (x-axis) and paternal hap-mers (y-axis) in that contig.
